reinforcements.similarity: Both address the gap between what the platform shows and what the user needs to understand. The library's System 1 Trust Gate focuses on visual/associative coherence at transitions. This run's Self-Articulating UI focuses on verbal/rational coherence at decision points. Together they form a complete principle: the UI must pass both the automatic first-impression test (System 1) AND the deliberate comprehension test (System 2 via articulation).
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library: phase transitions must signal continuity through visual consistency. New: every decision point must include rationale ('why this works this way'). Combined: the guest needs both visual trust (looks right) and verbal trust (explains itself).

reinforcements.existing_element_id: ds-ui-1001-005 (Space Care Photo Upload with Streak Counter)
reinforcements.similarity: Both address making the cleaning/flexibility effort feel rewarding rather than burdensome. The library element (Space Care streak) creates a pride-building ritual. This run's element adds the dollar-value dimension — showing the concrete financial impact of each cleaning submission.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library: streak counter transforms obligation into pride via 'reward of the self.' New: savings counter transforms obligation into smart economics via visible dollar value. Combined: the weekly cleaning flow should show BOTH the streak (pride) and the savings (economics) — they serve different psychological needs.

reinforcements.similarity: Both use the agent's name and personal voice to bridge human trust to digital interaction. The library email uses 'Bryant via Split Lease' and conversational tone. This run's element extends the same principle to ALL UI touchpoints, not just email.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library: agent-named emails feel personal and trustworthy. New: ALL status messages should name the agent and use first person. Combined: the agent trust bridge must extend from email into the product UI itself — every screen that shows status should feel like the agent is communicating.

reinforcements.similarity: Both use node-and-line visualizations to show progress through stages. The library element shows stay lifecycle (checkout → cleaning → arrival). This run's element shows matching lifecycle (submitted → review → matched → introduction). Same visual pattern, different context.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library: timeline format with dots gives structure to the between-stay period. New: pipeline format with nodes gives structure to the matching wait period. Combined: the timeline/pipeline pattern should be a reusable system component with consistent visual language across both contexts.

contradictions.conflict: The Platform Identity Declaration uses a 3-column comparison (SplitLease vs. Airbnb vs. Traditional Lease). The System 1 Trust Gate warns against introducing unfamiliar UI patterns that trigger threat detection. A comparison table on the homepage could feel like a marketing pitch rather than a trusted platform — potentially triggering System 1 rejection if it looks like an ad.
contradictions.evidence_comparison: The comparison approach is strongly evidenced by Theodore's call (he literally couldn't distinguish SplitLease from Airbnb). The System 1 concern is theoretical at discovery phase. Recommendation: keep the comparison but ensure it doesn't LOOK like an ad (no marketing colors, no stock photos, just clean data).
contradictions.recommendation: Keep comparison but style it as informational (Inter font, neutral colors, no gradients) rather than promotional to avoid triggering ad-blindness.

arc_conflicts: Discovery targets both 'curiosity' and 'confidence' — these can conflict if the platform appears too novel (curiosity) vs. too certain (confidence). Resolve by leading with curiosity and transitioning to confidence within the same page.
emotional_arc_check.arc_assessment: The emotional arc is coherent: Confusion (pre-discovery) → Curiosity (discovery) → Confidence (search/evaluation) → Safety (acceptance) → Satisfaction (active lease). The arc mirrors Theodore's call trajectory exactly. The most critical transition is listing_evaluation → proposal_creation, where anxiety about commitment must be resolved by the Protection Shield before the guest can feel confident enough to propose.
